intro: Phlox diffusa subsp. longistylis, commonly known as the long-styled phlox, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It features showy clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental plants with both aesthetic and ecological value.
